q: to Be Rude, But...'' in which he laid down five important principles that actors can use when auditioning. 1. Don't grovel when you come in. Simon Cowell writes I look upon it[ groveling] as a sign of desperation. So many times people come in and they come up with this terrible dialogue about how much they like me or Randy or Paula. It's demeaning, and there's no point to it. We're not looking for a nice person; we're looking for somebody who's confident and assured, but talented above all. Trust me-- most stars aren't nice. 2. In a news conference Friday, Stephen Elop and Steve Ballmer touted the alliance as good for both companies' aspirations. A pessimist sees the difficulty in every opportunity, but an optimist sees the opportunity in every difficulty, Stephen Elop said, quoting England's historic prime minister Winston Spencer-Churchill as he spoke in London.`` I am an optimist.'' It's not immediately clear what needs to be done to make the deal final
